Class: PathFinder

ai/pathfinder. PathFinder

new PathFinder(solid, diagonals, cutcorners, cost)

This constructor is curried when exposed through the engine ref, so construct it without the first parameter, e.g. new sn.PathFinder(solid, diagonals, ...);
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
solid Function <optional>
 A function that determines if a position is solid or not. Should accept an x,y position and return a boolean. True for solid. If omitted, the default is to check the tile grid properties for height>0
diagonals Boolean <optional>
 true If set, the path will include diagonal movements (Along tile corners).
cutcorners Boolean <optional>
 true Only has an effect if diagonals is true. If false, the path will move across tile edges when close to solid tiles, i.e. it will avoid the possibility of trying to cut across a solid corner.
cost Function <optional>
 A function that determines the cost factor of moving into a tile. It should return 1 for a normal tile and a number >1 for a tile that has some extra cost associated with moving into it. E.g. if a tile is water, return some value >1 to make a route avoid water unless it has no easy option. The higher the cost, the more likely it is that the water will be avoided.

Methods

route(x0, y0, x1, y1) → {Array}

Calculates a route from one position to another
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x0 Number X position of starting point
y0 Number X position of ending point
x1 Number Y position of starting point
y1 Number Y position of ending point
Returns:
An array of points as a 1d spanned array of the form x,y,x,y,x,y...
Type
Array

routeToDirections(route) → {Array}

Takes a route generated by route and creates a set of compass directions along the rotue that can be used to set directional state extensions in sprites.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
route Array Route in the form returned by route.
Returns:
An array of directions, e.g. ['e', 'se', 's']
Type
Array

routeToVectors(route) → {Array}

TODO: Not yet implemented. Takes a route generated by route and creates a set of normalized vectors along the route that can be used to influence movement.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
route Array Route in the form returned by route.
Returns:
A spanned array of 2D vectors in the form x,y,x,y,x,y...
Type
Array
